author: Christine Daly
text: 'Steph is super friendly and attentive and courteous the facility is immaculate and has a very homey feel the wasabeef sandwich had the perfect amount of wasa! Was delicious! üôèüåàüòã'

author: Stephen Stevens
text: 'On the side of the 9th street  Lightrail stadium.  Very busy in the AM with Friendly Fast Service. Healthy  Choices  and Foody Choices. Love my Morning Coffee and Americana. ie. EGG
column5: Cheese and Sausage  on a buttery hot Croissant.  Yum!!'

author: Ali Senatore
text: 'Always hospitable service. Excellent selection of wonderfully fresh sandwiches and healthy salad options. Cozy environment. Cafe is always clean. My favorite place to come for lunch.'

author: Karina Tantalean
text: 'Worker gave me the wrong order
column5: and then explained to me that iced coffee and cold brew are the same thing
column6: where I ordered a cold brew because it‚Äôs supposed to be steeped for at least 16 hours. Very expensive coffee as well.'

author: James Foley
text: 'Excellent spot
column5: good coffee
column6: great food. Friendly staff.  Biggie wrap is fire'

author: kate dubitski
text: "Coffee was good
column5: food was good. Great environment. Some people were working with laptops
column6: some families. Seems like they've got everyone covered!\nRight on the light rail train."

author: Melissa W.
text: 'Staff was lovely. Food and drink was as well!!'

author: A F
text: 'Delicious coffee but also delicious and hand made food! Tons of options. Most coffee shops in Hoboken lack good sandwiches/light lunch stuff. Everything we‚Äôve had here is delicious
column5: healthy
column6: and appropriately priced. Everyone who works there is very nice as well. Neighborhood gem üòç'

author: Joe Feghali
text: 'Best coffee shop in Hoboken! Intelligentsia coffee and high quality food. And the staff greets you with a smile every time. If I lived closer this would be my daily coffee shop'

author: Mark Colin
text: 'Absolutely warm
column5: friendly and beautiful place to hang out'

author: Abby Washuta
text: 'So good and so many gluten free options. The  owners take good food a d service seriously and it shows.'

author: Sylvia Kendrick
text: 'Hung up on and ignored because I wanted to order over the phone and per usually no one know what to do'

author: N FfJ
text: 'Horrible place and no one is trained properly or can speak English enough to make order correct I order and egg and cheese and got bacon I‚Äôm Muslim'

author: Jason Slocum
text: 'Great coffee and service'

author: Pete
text: "It's a chill little cafe type place right next to the 9th street light rail. Food was pretty good
column5: service was personable but not very fast/organized. Overall liked the place and the feel. Could be a good spot to study from or chill for a bit."

author: mxp 472
text: 'I‚Äôm reviewing the coffee here and all I can say is WOW!  They brew an excellent bean.  I take mine black with no sugar so I can capture the essence of the good stuff.  (And sometimes bad).  But this place really makes a spot on coffee.   I hope to enjoy a sandwich or snack with another cup sometime soon!'

author: Gregory Gioia
text: 'Great lunch menu employees really nice cool vide in place'

author: Elizabeth Windau
text: 'Tasty sandwiches
column5: great non-dairy options and exceptional coffee - I have to sigh a little ‚Äúoh
column6: yummmmm‚Äù every time I take my first sip'

author: Sanchit Kamath
text: 'Place is awesome.. spontaneously decided to have breakfast with my flatmate
column5: and ordered pico suave
column6: avocado toast
column7: latte and iced mocha. The coffee was great and so was the avocado toast. The staff was friendly and quick with the orders. Enjoyed my Sunday morning long after with NY Times on side.'

author: Grant Williams
text: 'Very warm welcoming staff. Good size sandwiches and wonderful coffee. I only wish they had chai and apple cider or chai and chocolate milk. But still excellent morning options'

author: Grace Encarnacion
text: 'Saw some good reviews before but as soon as I saw the review how they handled COVID related issues I was very disappointed. I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôm comfortable in supporting small business that don‚Äôt look out for their employees.'

author: Snehal Rajguru
text: 'I like the Cappuccino! Awesome üòå'

author: Scott Goldsworthy
text: 'Quaint nice place...'

author: Norman Matias
text: 'One staff member became sick
column5: was symptomatic of COVID and was asked by owner if they could at least continue for the remainder of their shift. That staff tested positive for COVID a day later.  Another staff member and their entire household became sick and tested COVID positive as a result. After all this
column6: another staff member opted for unpaid time off in order to avoid contracting COVID and was never given the opportunity to return to work.  When confronted about his decisions
column7: owner said he would not have done anything differently.\n\nOwner is irresponsible
column8: dangerously negligent and has flagrant disregard for safety of his customers and staff.'

author: Kenosha Color Painting Company
text: 'I love the energy that the owners give the employees are super great and coffee is amazing also their food is unbelievably very affordable definitely would recommend to anyone'

author: Henry Powell
text: 'great coffee'

author: nathan kim
text: 'hi uncle and aunt i miss you so much see you soon!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!'

author: Elise Mueller
text: 'Yummy Lattes. Clean place
column5: friendly staff.'

author: Kayleen Ormeno
text: 'First time coming here and came here during my work shift in a rush
column5: definitely will be coming back . Fast service
column6: great cold brewed coffee
column8: and an amazing staff. I told the woman who served me to make my coffee sweet with French vanilla
column9: she told me to try it and make sure I like it
column10: if not she can make it more sweet. She didn‚Äôt have to- it was Perfect!! Can‚Äôt wait to come back!'

author: Willie Young
text: 'Awesome place
column5: Nice surrounding area
column6: great atmosphere
column7: and sort of a cozy feel to it
column9: will definitely be a go to spot again for me. That PBNJ Vegan based Brownie

author: Dylan Felix
text: "Right off the 9th Street light rail
column5: this spot is a dream for getting a coffee and sandwich (and bathroom break) before hopping on a train for adventures unknown!\n\nThe food and coffee is always delicious
column6: and the people working here are always friendly.\n\nI recommend the Wasa Beef. It'll put moisture in your sinuses."

author: Cory Brask
text: 'Very fresh ingredients. Delicious food and coffee and just a step away from the light rail'

author: Chris S
text: "Cute little place. Wish it was local for me as I'd love to see more of what they have to offer. Enjoyed the matcha latte."

author: jon
text: 'Love this neighborhood place! The biggie is my go to! They do a great job all around
column5: great food
column6: great lemonade! And i love that anytime they mess up your order they own up to it and fix it! Cant beat it!!!!!'

author: Sarah Marrero
text: 'Nice
column5: cozy
column6: very pleasant service.  All within the cdc guidelines
column8: spacious and clean. Food ws delicious'

author: Claire STANISLAS
text: 'Really nice place and kind owners. The place is clean and cosy
column5: the egg muffin I ordered was really good and the owner made me a special coffee with decaffeinated coffee as I am pregnant though it was not on the menu. I really appreciated.'

author: Veronica B
text: 'A very cute mom and pop breakfast spot.  It was just extremely cold. (The doors were open). Very great food'

author: Maria Regina
text: 'cute spot near the tracks with a few outdoor tables. pastries are as good as the coffee'

author: sheillah Dallara
text: 'Cute coffee spot. Their drinks are very tasty and their avocado toast is so good! They offer all types of milk and NO upcharge if you want non dairy. Woohoo! Nice vibe as well.'

author: valon loshaj
text: 'The biggie wrap is amazing!!!'

author: Thomas Conboy
text: 'Dopest coffee'

author: Greg Guest
text: 'Great coffee

author: Tanja Guest
text: 'The absolutely best sandwiches in Hoboken!!! Awesome staff super friendly... very clean... great music... great WiFi!!! Love it'

author: Tyler Symons
text: 'Perfect well priced coffee shop'

author: Joanne McKinsley
text: "I have enjoyed black rail coffee for the past 3 years. Their pumpkin spice latte is like nothing I've had elsewhere. They also have lovely baked goods. They are always willing to go the extra mile if you want something special."

author: EMAN ALOFI
text: "This place is awesome. I'm thankful for getting to know this place by my friend. They are always welcoming. I already fall in love with their Latte.
column5: and their place in which it is often my spot for studying.\nThank you so much"

author: Claudia Gonzalez
text: 'Very friendly staff
column5: great outdoor and indoor seating ambiance
column6: and delicious high quality food! A Jersey City gem!'

author: Jay M
text: 'This place is awesome!  The food is amazing the products are second to none.  All high quality and amazing craftsmanship.  The energy in the place is vibrant.  You can feel the love'

author: Annie R
text: 'Great coffee - my favorite is the iced oat milk latte. We also love the avocado toast and the peanut butter toast.'

author: Casey Heffernan
text: 'Great place to get work done and tasty coffee. The ding-ding of the light rail going by is an added plus.'

author: Jin Kim
text: 'Great coffee and pastries!'

author: Young K
text: 'The coffee is high quality and very flavorful (I am very picky with my iced mocha and it was one of the best!)
column5: and breakfast options are diverse. The service was very prompt and staff was friendly. Outdoor seating options are pretty great too!'

author: Alex Price
text: 'The rosy beef sandwich is amazing'

author: Ikram Atmane
text: 'I just love this coffeeshop. Cozy
column5: clean

author: Laura Chevalier
text: "Kind staff

column6: and delicious food and coffee. I'll be back!"

author: Manette S
text: 'This is our go to breakfast spot. Food and coffee are very good. The owners are nice.'

author: Abhishek Jain
text: 'Ordered from here and after waiting for 1 hour and being bounced between the restaurant
column5: Chownow and Doordash
column6: never got the order. Owners of this restaurant need to get their process and vendor choice figured out so they‚Äôre able to actually retain customers. Terrible experience. Never going back or ordering. Maybe they do deserve to go out of business.'

author: Ed Wiegner
text: 'Great Coffee  Shop with Lots of food and snack options'

author: Corinna Zennig
text: 'The coffee was very good. I also enjoyed the specialty cookies they had. Looks like a cozy place to sit and hang with friends on the weekend. Maybe not the best place to work from as most chairs are plastic. Food menu looks diverse with breakfast and lunch options.'

author: alexa stone
text: 'I was thoroughly disappointed in the way I was treated at this establishment and HIGHLY request that they consider disability training with their staff.\n\nI had a trained service animal necessary for my daily function in a clearly labeled vest. Immediately upon entering they told me he could not be in here. I apologized for inconvenience but told them I cannot be separated from him. They asked for ‚Äúidentification‚Äù which is not required by law. They asked why I have him with me. I am not required to disclose my disability. I gave them an Americans with Disabilities act card and ordered my food and drink
column5: tipping 25%. My service dog laid calmly at my side the whole time. They asked ‚Äúto go?‚Äù I apologized and said I‚Äôd be working there. And they said ‚Äúwe have an outdoor area for that.‚Äù Not only is it cold and the middle of February
column6: but I let them know I needed an outlet and rather than letting me sit where I chose
column7: though there were many seats open in the large establishment
column8: they told me to sit in the very back corner
column9: even moving a customer to do so.\n\nWhen they called my name for food I was not allowed to go to the counter to pick it up
column10: they belittled me by forcing me to stay seated because they didn‚Äôt want myself and my dog approaching the counter.\n\nI wanted nothing less then to leave and not support this business any further
column11: but I stayed to work in order to show them a service animal has every right to be in an establishment. Toast laid quietly under the table for the 3 hours we spent here
column12: sitting up once to perform a task. We did not receive an apology.'

author: Katharine Smith
text: 'good times here great coffee!!'

author: Michelle T
text: 'Food and drinks are great
column5: but because they cater towards families
column6: be prepared to be in the presence of a lot of kids - a lot
column7: and most of them under age 5.'

author: Ivy Jade
text: 'Extraordinary a coffee shop.\nAll kinds of food are served beautifully.'

author: Josh Ellison
text: 'Best avocado toast in Hoboken. No contest. Coming from someone with severe avocado toast OCD.'

author: David Donovan
text: 'Good coffees'

author: Amit Kumar
text: "Sweet coffeehouse vibe with friendly staff
column5: ample seating (bench had cushions)
column6: can see the trains through the window (yet not loud at all). Enjoyed a delicious hot vanilla latte! Breakfast sandwich (SE&C) was tasty but not very filling. I'd come backüëçüèº"

author: Amazon Querida
text: 'Great place to come with kids'

author: Andrew G
text: "The coffee and breakfast sandwich (actually all the sandwiches) are great and it's not too loud. A great neighborhood spot. You can get Intelligencia coffee beans there
column5: too."

author: Joshua Laryea
text: 'Nice quiet place to grab a coffee and get some work done.'

author: Vivek Narayanan
text: 'One of my favorite coffee shops in town. Has some of the best cold brew - stumptown coffee and plenty of room to sit. Added bonus - you‚Äôll always see cute artwork done by kids in the nearby day care centers.\n\nFolks at the counter are always super friendly and cheer me up'

author: Taylor Gentry
text: "Black Rail Coffee serves great food and coffee selection. My colleagues and I love their cold brew coffee to keep us wide awake coz were graveyard on our work. Good customer service. Well mannered staffs. I like the place it's so comfy. Gotta be back here again and again."

author: A C
text: 'Nice atmosphere
column5: good service'

author: ad s
text: 'Very bad clientele service
column5: as I got to the door before I order I asked for restroom key they declined until I buy something first
column6: it‚Äôs a shame'

author: J-Rocks!
text: 'Nice cafe near the station
column5: efficient staff and healthy options.'

author: Schwinn Zhang
text: 'First of
column5: the WiFi wasn‚Äôt working. Then
column6: it gets a horror movie vibe. I was sitting with my drinks. A waiter sprayed table cleaning products right next to me and I saw it fell into my drinks. Will NEVER come here again.'

author: Victoria Verdel
text: 'Best Coffee in Hoboken.'

author: Clint Edwards (Darkheart)
text: 'The iced hibiscus tea was good'

author: Anthony Cruz
text: 'FAV COFFEE IN NJ & THE TURKEY MEETS HAM SANDWICH IS INCREDIBLE!'

author: Jeff N
text: "3 people behind the counter all ignoring me when I'm  the only person in line. At least say I'll be with you soon. Finally
column5: she  asked me if I was here to see somebody on their staff
column6: and I said no I'm ordering a latte
column7: after which they talked amongst themselves amazed about how funny it was that I wasn't the person coming to see the other person rather than take my order. Otherwise the latte was fine once they finally took my order and prepared it."

author: Matthew Goczalk
text: 'Nice coffee shop with plenty of seating
column5: but occasionally the music gets a little loud.'

author: Stuart Ginsberg
text: "One of the best coffee spots in Hoboken. Crowded
column5: but the line is quick
column6: and you're able to sit and hang out without feeling rushed. Excellent pastries and sandwiches too."

author: Marie Escaped
text: "This place is the best coffee place in Hoboken!\nFirst
column5: it is very very clean
column6: which is so rare these days. People do not touch money and your food using the same gloves. After each customer the gloves are being changed.\n\nAlso
column7:
it is very delicious. The owner and his team do have taste. Salmon avocado toast is to die for! The coffee is great as well. Pastries are being delivered from a very nice bakery.

This place is both kids and work friendly. It is cozy and welcoming.

The only thing I would add to this place is a cranberry walnut scone from Gregory's :)"

author: Zack Russo
text: 'Took very very long for sandwich. It was tasty but not worth the 25 min wait. It was also not busy at all'

author: Animesh
text: 'Very good coffee shop for morning commuters'

author: zachary huston

author: Rachel Evans
text: 'This picky palate never knew a coffee could have such a wonderful profile and be so texturally creamy! Cheers to the best coffee in the city!'

author: Nick Lenzi
text: "Love this place. The staff is fantastic and personable. The coffee is from Intelligentsia so it's delicious. They have great seasonal items and make some good sandwiches. Also they have these best cold brew in town and have the best ice."

author: P.M.R SERVICES L.L.C
text: 'Good sandwich'

author: Dervish Kamil
text: 'Great food and coffee. Cozy and comfortable atmosphere. A fantastic staff of some great people'

text: 'The owner s. Are. Best'

text: 'ü§óthey awesome ....'

text: 'Coffee taste like dirt'

author: Jonathan Greenstein
text: 'Go for the coffee.  Not the food unless you want to wait 15 minutes while your sandwich is made at a snails pace. You can actually watch it be made a record slow speeds.'

author: Pearl Stars
text: 'New coffee place with good coffee selection
column5: good chai latter and healthy snack options. They sell local honey which is amazing. I have bought a large jar of honey. If you have small kids
column6: then this place has lots of story books for them to indulge in. The best part of this place is that you have the rare view of a hill on the backside. Also very relaxing to also sit outside. An ideal place to hide and read.'

author: Christian Butts

text: 'My Hoboken coffee shop. Solid food and coffee options. I dig their Biggie references.'

author: Mell MMG
text: 'Feels like home.'

author: Rob Colfer
text: 'Love this spot'

author: Marie E
text: 'Best coffee in the neighborhood!!! James and other people who work there are so nice. They remember us by names and they remember our usuals. Very tasty coffee and pastries. This place makes my day brighter.'

author: Jessica Amaro
text: "Good coffee
column5: great food and the staff is so friendly and helpful.  A little off the beaten path and closes early but great if you work from home or need a quick lunch uptown.  It's close to the light rail
column6: literally next to it and the elevator.  Large windows show the cliff and plenty of seating with nooks and a couple outlets. Outdoor seating is available and covered."

text: 'Brandon makes the best sausage egg and cheese super wonder bagels on the planet (sup guys)'

author: Angelina Valles

text: 'My favorite coffee in Hoboken! I stop in at least twice a week. Besides fantastic coffee
column5: the food menu is an all-star
column6: all the time. I‚Äôve never eating anything other than sumptuous
column7: fresh ingredients.\n\nThe late day bargains on the pastries and baked goods are my favorite!!'

author: Daniel L
text: 'Great coffee
column5: great food
column6: awesome local spot. James is the man.'

author: Dee Cee
text: 'Convenient location by light rail. A little bit pricey'

author: Damian De Virgilio
text: 'Good coffee.  Friendly
column5: professional staff.'

author: David Orr
text: 'They know their coffee
column5: from pulling a shot of espresso to making cold brew. Good for a quick grab and go breakfast sandwich before jumping on the light rail
column6: which is next to the shop. Plenty of room for strollers so it is a favorite of moms and nannies. Kid friendly space
column7: even a book rack with kids books. I prefer the New York Times which they also get every day. Obviously one of my favorite places.'

author: Liza Pliss
text: "Good coffees. Great service. They are overdoing it on the amount of stuff they offer - it's just too much - but who cares? The basics are great. And there's plenty of places to sit. Just wish it was cozier (comfy chairs vs plastic)."

author: Megan Yavoich
text: 'Love the Money Honey sandwich! Yum!'

author: Pieter Sommen
text: "A nice surprise at Hoboken's western border: good coffee and good service. Both were appreciated."

author: Barry Weinstein
text: "Small local coffee shop
column5: convenient if you're in the neighborhood
column6: just OK... Ok coffee (nothing really special)
column7: Ok atmosphere (not very comfortable)... Needs an upgrade."

author: Nando Speers
text: 'Great place
column5: excellent coffee and pastries and some serious sandwiches.\nQuiet and cool... one of my favorite places to sit with my laptop to work a little. Closes a little early though.'

author: Elodie Poons
text: 'People working are super friendly.'

author: Viviane Oliveira
text: "Love love love the cappuccino
column5: specially when made by the owner. The avocado toast with salmon and the healthy sandwich are mine and boyfriend's favourites. The honey they sell there is to die for. Perfect spot. Best place! Need to get my Notorious B.I.G mug üòâ"

author: Bartley P. O'Dwyer

author: Rohan Kusre
text: 'Just a bit pricey but the coffee is top notch
column5: the sandwiches are quality and the staff is friendly as hell.'

author: Joel Neuenhaus
text: 'Awesome staff and great food/coffee selection'

author: Kuppi Coffee
text: 'Coffee is great and so are the sanwiches. Try their specials! The thanksgiving turkey sandwich is great!'

author: Hind Bugshan
text: "Was my first and will b last visit. They gave me someone's sandwich which I couldn't recognized it till later they came to gave me my actual order which unfortunately had onion and I asked for no onion as I'm sensitive to .. So I had to return it with a new one
column5: and I should get my money back or at least my tip as a sorry for mistaken my order
column6: .. My order was called Healthy Sandwich and guess what?! It was so greasy .. Are you kidding me?!!! Is that why they call it HEATHY!"

author: Dustin Glass
text: "The food and coffee are always spot on. Try the avocado toast (sprinkled with chili flakes which is great)
column5: as well as the Turkey Meets Jam sandwich. The only drawback is that they're not open on Sundays and it is a tad pricey."

author: Kevin Kim
text: "Nice shop with tasty bites. Their espresso was the best Intelligentsia shot I've had."

author: Elizabeth Markham
text: 'Coffee is solid. Pastries go on serious discount around 4pm so they can sell before they close.'

author: Sam Kopolovich
text: 'Coffee is solid
column5: location and ambience cant be beat.'

author: yeseul lee
text: 'Great place to enjoy a coffee and study by notebook'

author: Chunhee Choi
text: 'Great spot to enjoy coffee and sandwiches.'

author: Drew Pronko
text: 'Great spot in a growing neighborhood. The sandwiches are unique and tasty. Very good espresso drinks with Intelligentsia coffee.'

author: Monika Belur
text: "This place is so great. Great Coffee
column5: Great Sandwiches
column6: and toddlers and little kids can't get enough of watching the trains go by."

author: Nilo Ayer
text: "Great spot. I go there at least once a week for breakfast. Their iced coffee is delicious. I usually go for the bagels
column5: which are also good
column6: but their sandwiches are top notch as well. I like the fact that they support local artists and products. I got a pot of honey made locally by one of their customers and it's off the charts. Besides all that
column7: convenient location + a cool look is a win in my book. Cheers"

author: Robert Perez
text: 'Right by the train station but a little expensive foods not too bad Coffee great'

author: Michael Domanic
text: 'The best coffee in Hoboken. The nicest people in Hoboken. The best sandwiches in Hoboken.'

author: Gabriel Rumbaut
text: "Awesome little spot. I LOVE their coffee. Prices aren't unreasonable."

author: Manvir Kalsi
text: 'Amazing coffee and sandwiches with the nicest owners I have ever met. If you are in area you have to try it out.'

author: Daniel Patterson
text: 'Excellent food
column5: and amazing customer service. I pretty much made this my regular spot to visit every day for work. Try the WasaBeef~ 5/5.'

author: Frank Deste
text: 'I think the people that work here write their own reviews. Actually the place itself is not bad
column5: but the people that work here have to have more customer friendly skills.I was greeted the other day with " what do you want boss!" Now I don\'t know is the is derogatory or not bit I take offense to that term means something or not  but I did take offense to it. I am not this guys boss but it is sad that I got treated like a jerk...i will never enter this place again...'

author: DG KIM
text: 'Awesome place!!! Tried all of their sandwiches and each of them are all uniquely delicious and I bet you will come back for more to try the different yet creative sandwiches they offer. If you are getting tired of eating any other regular subs/sandwiches
column5: then this place is a must go for you. Also dont forget to get the ice coffee
column6: very smooth and good quality tasting ice coffee
column7: unlike those cheap one dollar coffee you can pick up anywhere else.'

author: nick piergallini
text: "This place isn't a bad place
column5: but their prices are unreasonably expensive for what they offer. If you want to spend $4.25 on a 16oz iced coffee that is NOTHING special
column6: go here. I would rather spend $3 on a Starbucks trenta (30oz) coffee."
